intro: Antennaria campestris, commonly known as the prostrate mouse-eared cow-wheat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are white or pale pink, appearing in early spring. Antennaria campestris is often found in association with other wildflowers in temperate regions.
